Dear Prof. Goodwin,

as I mentioned some time ago, I'm interested in sensitivity analysis for
reaction rate parameters and spent a little time to search for possibilities
to make it with CANTERA. My conlcusions are:

- most simple sensitivity analysis and working for all reaktors: solve the
problem with small differences of the reaction rate parameters.
Disadvantage: very time consuming when the number of parameters is high...

- for reaktors using zero-dimensional kinetics: there is a free available
code for solving ODE's with simultaneous solution of the differential
equations for sensitivity. This code is similar to 'cvode', it's name is
'cvodes' and it is included in the most actual release of 'cvode'-package
from sandia. I tried to implement it, but there are some problems because
the memory management is a little bit different from the 'cvode' used in
cantera. Second problem is that 'cvodes' needs a pointer to the
parameters(matrix) for which the sensitivity analysis should be done. This
means 'cvode.cpp' should have access to a matrix of the reaction rate
parameters (preexponential factor, Beta and activation energy). Both
problems seems to be solvable with no big effort, but require a deep look
and possibly reconstruction of some parts of the cantera-memory management,
which should only be done by the developers - which have the 'memory
philosophy' in mind.

Finally I suggest to solve these problems and extend the possibilities of
CANTERA...

best regards
